mapper.select: select c.id as c_id, s.id as s_id, user_id, title, contents, created_time, updated_time, board_type, `like`, view_count, s.study_group_id, name from content c inner join skill s on c.study_group_id = s.study_group_id where board_type =1

select c.id as c_id, s.id as s_id, user_id, title, contents, created_time, updated_time, board_type, `like`, view_count, name, recruit_period, start_date, end_date, total_member from content c inner join study_group s on c.study_group_id = s.id where board_type =1

select c.id as c_id, u.id as u_id, c.user_id, title, contents, created_time, updated_time, board_type, `like`, view_count, user_email, password, nickname from content c inner join user u on c.user_id = u.id where board_type =1

select c.id as c_id, u.id as u_id, c.user_id, title, contents, created_time, updated_time, board_type, `like`, view_count, user_email, password, nickname from content c inner join user u on c.user_id = u.id where c.board_type =1 and c.id=#{id}
mapper.insert: insert into study_group(name ,recruit_period, start_date, end_date, total_member) values(#{name}, #{recruit_period}, #{start_date}, #{end_date}, #{total_member})
insert into content(user_id ,title, contents, board_type, study_group_id) values(1, #{title}, #{contents}, 1, #{study.id})
